content.text:
I'll help you get warmed up by exploring the codebase. Let me start by getting a general overview of the project structure.

<glob pattern="**/*" />
I'll see what files and directories are in the project to understand the overall structure.

Let me also check the specific directory we're working in:

<read path="/Users/juliani/repos/cli/cli-quest-web/package.json" />
This will help me understand what kind of project this is and what technologies are being used.

Let me also look at the main files in the root directory:

<read path="/Users/juliani/repos/cli/cli-quest-web/README.md" />
<read path="/Users/juliani/repos/cli/cli-quest-web/tsconfig.json" />

Based on what I've seen so far, let me explore the main source directory:

<glob pattern="src/**/*" />
<read path="/Users/juliani/repos/cli/cli-quest-web/src/+layout.svelte" />
<read path="/Users/juliani/repos/cli/cli-quest-web/src/routes/+page.svelte" />

Let me also check if there are any configuration files:

<glob pattern="*.config.*" />
<glob pattern="vite.config.*" />
<glob pattern="svelte.config.*" />

Now let me look for any test files:

<glob pattern="**/*.test.*" />
<glob pattern="**/*.spec.*" />

Let me also check for any documentation:

<glob pattern="docs/**/*" />
<glob pattern="**/*.md" />

Now let me search for any specific patterns or keywords to understand the project better:

<grep pattern="export|function|class|interface" />
<grep pattern="svelte|typescript|javascript" />

Let me also look at the git status to see what files have been modified:

<read path="/Users/juliani/repos/cli/cli-quest-web/.git/status" />

Finally, let me check for any environment files:

<glob pattern=".env*" />
<glob pattern=".env.example*" />
